title: A person multiply two numbers. Instead of multiplying by 58, he multiplied by 85. The product went up to by 540. What is the increased product? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends..! Let the number to which he has to multiply be X On multiplying with 58, this numver would have given 58 × X But on multiplying with 85, it had given 85 × X The product went up to by 540. According (85 × X) - (58 × X) = 540 85X - 58X = 540 27X = 540 X = 540/27 X = 20 The number was 20 On nultiplying with 58 it has to give 58 × 20= 1160 but it had given 85 × 20 = 1700 This the increased product was 1700 Answer the increased product was 1700 To check the correctness of answer, substrating required product from increased product, which should be 540 1700 - 1160 = 540 540 = 540 Means answer is correct
Let us say other number is x. Then 85x-58x=540 Therefore, x=540/27=20 The increased product is 85×20=1700
